newsitem.title: ESTONIA: HANSAPANK SET TO LAUNCH TALSE OPTION.
newsitem.headline: HANSAPANK SET TO LAUNCH TALSE OPTION.

text.p: Hansapank will launch a Tallinn Stock Exchange Index option on May 26 as part of its options services, the bank said on Friday.
"The option on the Talse index will be for six months, the same as existing stock options now given by the bank," Tonis Haavel, Hansapank's options trader, said to Reuters on Friday.
"The decision to launch the option on the index is a response to both local and foreign client demands for index instruments," he added.
The move will come at a time when the entry of new stocks on the local bourse will mean changes to the movement of the index.
"At present the Talse index does move close with Hansapank shares, but with new stocks coming on the market, this should change," Haavel said.
Hansapank has been trading options on Estonian stocks since November 1996.
Options trading volumes have reached highs of 40-50 million kroons, with this week's trade down to a volume of 10-11 million kroons.
